item.title: Sen, Bag - commentary
item.description: CHAPTER 1 UNITS OF MEASUREMENTS, CONSTRUCTION OF SQUARES AND RECTANGLES, KNOWLEDGE OF SURD, THEOREM OF SQUARE ON THE DIAGONAL AND RELATED PROBLEMS. In the first two chapters Baudhāyana has given a summary of geometrical knowledge and some results of mathematical interest required for the construction of sacrificial altars. How the knowledge was used in connection with the measuring of grounds and placing of different layers of bricks has been discussed in detail in subsequent chapters.

item.title: Sen, Bag - Translation
item.description: 1 1.1 The various constructions of sacrificial fires are now given. 1.2 We shall explain the methods of measuring areas of their (different) figures (drawn) on the ground. 1.3. Now, the measure of an angula is 14 anus (grain of Panicum milliaceum); according to others, (it is) 34 tilas (sesamum indicum) placed broad side on. One small pada is 10 aǹgulas; one prādeśa 12 añgulas; one pṛthā and one uttara- yuga 13 angulas each; one (big) pada 15 añgulas.
